data.title: âShrink The Box on Apple Podcasts
data.meta_description:
Ever wondered why Frasier Crane is such a snob? 
How Tyrion Lannisterâs bawdy humour saves him in Game of Thrones? 
What makes Schitts Creekâs Moira Rose a narcissist? 

âShrink the Boxâ is where actor comedian Ben Bailey Smith and psychotherapist Nemone Metaxas put their favourite fictional charactâ¦
data.text:
Ben and Nemone put Jennifer Aniston and Reese Witherspoonâs The Morning Show characters, Alex and Bradley, on the couch. We ask how a person creates a false self at work, what makes Bradley break the mould and find out how Alex could ever have respect for her male boss in the middle of a #MeToo scandal. Stay tuned for more on false selves in our upcoming episodes on Jackson Lamb and Polly Shelby too!

We want to hear about any theories we might have missed, what youâve thought of the show so far and your character suggestions. Please drop the team an email (which may be part of the show): shrinkthebox@sonymusic.com

NEXT CLIENTS ON THE COUCH. Find out how to view here

Tasha, Orange is the New Black (season 2)

Polly, Peaky Blinders (seasons 1&2)

Reginald "Bubbles" Cousins, The Wire (Season 1)

Moira Rose, Schitt's Creek (Season 1)

Raymond Holt, Brooklyn 99 (selected episodes)

Jackson Lamb, Slow Horses (Season 1)

CREDITS

We used clips from Season 1 of The Morning Show. Itâs available to watch on AppleTV+.

Ben and Nemone put Tyrion Lannister from Game of Thrones on the couch. Tyrion doesnât conform to societyâs norms. How does he use that to his advantage? Heâs booksmart, cunning and the most open-minded man in Westeros. This âhalf-manâ is, in fact, three times as impressive as any of his peers. We look into difference, diversity and skulduggery in this latest episode. Donât miss it!Â

We want to hear about any theories we might have missed, what youâve thought of the show so far and your character suggestions. Please drop the team an email (which may be part of the show): shrinkthebox@sonymusic.comÂ

Ben and Nemone put sous-chef Sydney Adamu from The Bear into therapy. She helps whip the team at the restaurant into shape, sheâs nurturing but anxious and riddled with self-doubt, not to mention a person of colour with the highest of ambitions in a profession dominated by white men. Mouthwatering, no?Â

Â

We want to hear about any theories we might have missed, what youâve thought of the show so far and your character suggestions. Please drop the team an email (which may be part of the show): shrinkthebox@sonymusic.comÂ

Ben and Nemone put Chandler from Friends on the famous Central Perk couch to talk about his phobia of commitment, his attachment patterns and how he feels about mum AND dad putting on a black dress and trying to seduce one of your best friends. Expect doses of sarcasm, celebrity cameos and Janiceâs laughter peppered throughout.

We want to hear about any theories we might have missed, what youâve thought of the show so far and your character suggestions. Please drop the team an email (which may be part of the show): shrinkthebox@sonymusic.com
